days.memex_snapshot:
# Memex — alex_chen (Alex)

## Who He Is
Builder-thinker. GitHub: alex_chen. Company: Acme Labs AI Inc. Started Syke Christmas Day 2025, 54+ day sustained sprint. Thinks about identity and human representation in data — this goes back 7+ years (Persona). Precise, structured, no fluff. Plans before code. Dislikes robotic copy.

---

## What's Hot Right Now

**Syke — v0.3.0, post-hackathon push**
- Live on PyPI at v0.3.0. v0.2.9 ("Clean Slate", Feb 17) was first public release with clean git history; v0.3.0 docs audit confirmed clean state Feb 18.
- 297 tests. 8 MCP tools. `uvx syke setup --yes`. Demo: syke-ai.vercel.app. Docs: syke-docs.vercel.app.
- Active viz work: `ProductContextGap.tsx` animated rewrite — "you are the integration layer." Left: AI grinds through 5 tools sequentially. Right: Syke answers instantly. The asymmetry IS the argument.
- Open bug (GitHub issue #1): daemon blocked by unnecessary `ANTHROPIC_API_KEY` check even when using Agent SDK path.
- Companion product **Tamago Studio** in early design: shared creator tool, currently at /studio in Syke repo, target Cloudflare Workers/Pages. Architecture question open: how does a single Studio instance serve multiple isolated Syke instances?

**Persona — v0.3 pre-release, evaluation grind**
- Separate project under Acme Labs AI Inc. Path: `.../persona/`
- Knowledge graph memory system for AI. Older, more research-grade than Syke.
- Release blocked on rigorous SOTA claims: PersonaMem + BEAM benchmarks. Competitor: Graphiti.
- Heavy evidence reconstruction work Feb 18: correlating session milestones with git commits and eval artifacts (Jan 10–Feb 11 timeline). Goal: "aggressive but defensible" SOTA messaging.

---

## Infrastructure State

**Azure:**
- $8,982 Microsoft Sponsorship credits, expires Aug 22, 2026
- Claude Sonnet 4.5 on Azure Foundry since Dec 22, 2025. Billing uncertainty: no Anthropic meters visible in Cost Management API — may be separate Marketplace billing.
- `claude-az` alias separates Azure Foundry usage from standard `claude login` (Max plan) default.
- Remaining VMs: moltbot ($12/mo) + pogu-openclaw ($12/mo) = $24/mo
- Deleted Feb 18 to save $38/mo: acme-labs-staging (Acme Labs API, Surfer Agent, 3 VPN services) + kaleidos-vm (Kaleidos API, Discord bot)
- DNS cleanup still needed for deleted VMs.

---

## Settled / Background

**Syke architecture:** Python 3.12+, Claude Agent SDK, MCP, Next.js viz, Nextra docs. Daemon: launchd (macOS) / cron (Linux). Only `syke/` ships to PyPI — viz/, docs-site/, tests/ excluded.

**Syke branding (settled Feb 17):** "Agentic Memory." Audience: AI-native power users. Tone: technical but human, no em dashes, no robotic phrases. Hero: "Keeps every AI in sync with you." Psyche wordplay intentional, subtle.

**Persona vs Syke:** Different products, related problem space. Persona = research-grade, graph-based, Acme Labs-branded. Syke = personal context daemon, fast-moving, public.

**Other projects (dormant/deleted):** Kaleidos (3 Headed Fractal), Acme Labs API — both VMs deleted Feb 18. Surfer Agent (browser automation) was running on acme-labs-staging.

**Distribution vision:** Each person gets their own isolated Syke instance. Close friends in close-alpha. Non-technical users should be able to self-host without cloud expertise.

days.memex_snapshot:
# Memex — alex_chen (Alex)

## Who He Is
Builder-thinker. GitHub: alex_chen. Company: Acme Labs AI Inc. Started Syke Christmas Day 2025, 60+ day sustained sprint. Thinks about identity and human representation in data — this goes back 7+ years (Persona). Precise, structured, no fluff. Plans before code. Dislikes robotic copy. Uses "ULTRAWORK mode" in Claude sessions for max-precision tasks. Runs Prometheus/Sisyphus/Momus multi-agent orchestration for heavy engineering.

---

## What's Hot Right Now

**Persona — accuracy push, active branch (Feb 19-20, 2026)**
- Branch: `eval/accuracy-fix-80plus`. Target: 66.2% → 80%+ on PersonaMem.
- **Hard numbers:** 100Q baseline 63%, 589Q baseline 66.2%. Psyche drag: -9.41pp (psy_share>0: 57.18% vs 66.59% without).
- **8 tasks executed via Prometheus/Sisyphus:** psyche env var gates, provenance quality gate, EVOLVED_FROM temporal evolution, AttractorCards v2 schema + consolidation + context formatting.
- AttractorCards v2: PsycheMemory now has `preference_direction`, `valence`, `seed_ids`, `confidence`, `time_profile`. Only psyche with confidence ≥ 0.6 and provenance links enters working memory.
- PRs #11–14 merged at v0.3.0. Claim governance settled: PersonaMem + BEAM only.

**syke-deli Monorepo + Tamago Studio — MVP push**
- "syke-deli" is the monorepo. Tamago Studio UI at `packages/syke-ui/`.
- Feb 18–19 cleanup: deleted wordle.js, onboarding.js, workspace tour, mobile gate, paper theme. Fixed auth timing bugs. Added Studio access gate.
- Architecture question still open: how does one Studio instance serve multiple isolated Syke instances?
- Target deploy: Cloudflare Workers/Pages.

**Syke — post-v0.3.0, active development**
- Live on PyPI at v0.3.0. 378 passing tests. 8 MCP tools. Anthropic badge: Opus 4.6.
- Open bug (GitHub issue #1): daemon blocked by unnecessary `ANTHROPIC_API_KEY` check even when using Agent SDK path.
- Source attribution bug: most "claude-code" ingested sessions are actually OpenCode (Sisyphus/Prometheus/Momus). Wrong source in ingestion layer.

---

## Strategic Research (Feb 20, 2026)

**Syke's thesis is unique — confirmed.** Academic memory work (GAM, A-MEM, HEMA) targets task performance, not identity. Anthropic shipped CLAUDE.md and context engineering — no autonomous identity synthesis. Cross-platform identity synthesis via background daemon → MCP doesn't exist anywhere else. Industry won't catch up because they're building in a different direction.

**MCP security broken + tool calling may be peaking.** Real breaches, no auth on ~2K servers. CodeAct shows 20% better perf + 30% fewer steps vs tool calling. Simon Willison: "MCP is a one-year wonder." Skills (markdown + scripts) displacing MCP for coding agents. Impact on Syke: local server sidesteps security issues, but `ask()` tool-calling pattern has a ceiling. Moat = cognitive architecture, not protocol.

---

## Infrastructure State
- Azure: $8,982 credits, expires Aug 22, 2026. `claude-az` alias for Azure Foundry.
- Remaining VMs: moltbot + pogu-openclaw = $24/mo. DNS cleanup pending for deleted VMs.

---

## Settled / Background
- Syke: Python 3.12+, Agent SDK, MCP, Next.js viz, Nextra docs. launchd/cron daemon. Only `syke/` ships to PyPI.
- Branding: "Agentic Memory." No em dashes, no robotic copy. Hero: "Keeps every AI in sync with you."
- Distribution: isolated per-person Syke instances. Studio = shared layer on top. Close friends in closed alpha.
- Persona 4-pillar memory model: Episode, Psyche, Entity, Note. Neo4j graph + vector embeddings. Dream state (background consolidation), subconscious update paths.
- Orchestration: Prometheus (plan, read-only) → Momus (review) → Sisyphus (execute). Evidence saved to `.sisyphus/evidence/`.

reasoning_trace.notes: Write-side calls inferred from memory_ops; read-side tools reflect synthesis loop defaults.

memories_added: Syke v0.3.5 "Three Verbs" shipped to PyPI on Feb 22, 2026. The release name says everything about the design philosophy: the MCP surface was cut from 10 tools down to exactly 3 — get_live_context, ask, record. Three verbs. That's the whole interface. CHANGELOG updated, CI green, docs live. Test count at 358 (badge in README shows 398 — slight discrepancy, possibly stale badge). This is a significant simplification milestone post-v0.3.0.

Issue #2 in Syke is the ask() timeout problem, active as of Feb 22, 2026. The ask() tool uses Anthropic Agent SDK internally to explore the user timeline — this can take 5–60+ seconds depending on query complexity. MCP clients like Claude Code have transport timeouts, so slow queries hang and drop. Investigation mapped the full chain: MCP client → MCP server → ask agent → Anthropic API. Looking at three potential fixes: streaming progress notifications (MCP protocol may support this), async tool execution with polling, or timeout guards that return partial results. ASK_MAX_TURNS config limits agent iterations but doesn't solve the transport timeout problem.

Mobile viz fix shipped Feb 22, 2026. The LatentFluid SVG animation — which uses filter: blur(60px) on circles plus feTurbulence + feDisplacementMap — renders as hard-edged shapes on real iOS Safari and Chrome Android (GPU compositing behaves differently). Chrome DevTools emulation doesn't reproduce it. Fix: conditional rendering — CSS radial gradients on mobile, full SVG animation on desktop. Also added triple-layer overflow prevention (html + body + page root) and fixed all stale "8/6 MCP tools" references to "3 MCP tools". Branch fix/mobile-viz merged to main, Vercel deployed, verified on real phone.

Critical Persona eval bug discovered Feb 22, 2026: PersonaMem context (183 turns) was being collapsed into 1 session instead of being processed as separate sessions. This would silently corrupt benchmark results — the eval framework had implicit assumptions about what a "session" means that didn't match Persona's ingestion model. Triggered a full audit of all eval data pipelines: PersonaMem, LongMemEval, and BEAM loaders, runner.py session prep, persona_adapter.py ingest_batch, and the /ingest/batch endpoint. The goal is to document the session → episode contract so eval authors have a clear reference.
links_created: Issue #2 (ask() timeout) is a direct consequence of the v0.3.5 MCP simplification — ask() is now one of only 3 exposed tools and its latency problem becomes the central reliability issue

PersonaMem session collapse bug affects the eval accuracy work — the 66.2% baseline may be artificially deflated by incorrect session ingestion, making the accuracy push numbers unreliable until the p

days.memex_snapshot:
# Memex — alex_chen (Alex)

## Who He Is
Builder-thinker. GitHub: alex_chen. Company: Acme Labs AI Inc. Started Syke Christmas Day 2025, 60+ day sprint. Thinks about identity + human representation in data — 7+ years (Persona). Precise, no fluff. Plans before code. ULTRAWORK mode in Claude. Runs Prometheus/Sisyphus/Momus orchestration.

---

## What's Hot Right Now

**Memory layer quality crisis — active fix (Feb 23)**
- Experiment on 1,081 real events: consolidation ran 8× but produced only 1 memory. Memex bloated to 15,949 chars of narrative. Agent made 0 tool calls — answered entirely from text blob.
- Assessment: memex is a status report, not a routing table. Active Stories = 500-word logs, not 2-line pointers.
- Fix in progress (`storage` branch): reorder consolidation prompt (memories first), hard-require ≥1 memory per run, cap Active Stories at 2 lines each.
- → Memory: `0699e07d-0709-79bf`

**Storage layer philosophy shift (Feb 23)**
- Three new principles locked: "ledger not disk" (immutable append-only, event sourcing), identity for human+agent ensembles (agents like "Julian" get their own Syke identity), markdown→DB trajectory (harnesses converge on markdown, Syke is the database layer underneath).
- claude-mem studied as reference: FTS5 + ChromaDB, Agent SDK compression, ~30K stars.
- → Memory: `0699e07d-ab03-7287`

**Tamago Studio MVP refactor — just started (Feb 23)**
- Audit of `packages/tamago-studio/` + `packages/syke-runtime/src/studio/`. Access gate, forge system, half-done features under inspection.
- Open Qs: how one Studio instance serves multiple isolated Syke instances. Deploy: Cloudflare Workers/Pages.
- → Memory: `0699e07e-8e34-714a`

**Issue #2 (ask() timeout) — closed (Feb 23)**
- Fixed with timeout guard in mcp_server.py. Claude Desktop = 30s hard limit (not configurable). Progress notifications are cosmetic only — don't extend timeout.
- → Memory: `0699e07e-03f5-7968`

**Syke v0.3.5 "Three Verbs" — shipped (Feb 22)**
- MCP surface: `get_live_context`, `ask`, `record`. 358 tests. CI/PyPI/Docs green.

**alex_chen.io — 3D Sri Yantra hero live (Feb 23)**
- Branch `refactor/design-content`. Three.js: 9-triangle Maha Meru, fold/unfold 20s cycle, bloom, star field, CRT scanlines. Time-of-day colors: night=cyan, golden hour=amber, day=violet.
- → Memory: `0699e07e-471b-7a90`

---

## Infrastructure
- Azure: $8,982 credits, expires Aug 22, 2026. `claude-az` alias.
- VMs: moltbot + pogu-openclaw = $24/mo. DNS cleanup pending.

---

## Settled / Background
- Syke: Python 3.12+, Agent SDK, MCP, Next.js viz, Nextra docs. launchd/cron daemon. Only `syke/` ships to PyPI.
- Persona: 4-pillar memory (Episode, Psyche, Entity, Note). Neo4j + vector. Eval pipeline audit ongoing — 183-turn context collapse bug. Accuracy baseline (66.2%) may be unreliable.
- Branding: "Agentic Memory." No em dashes. Hero: "Keeps every AI in sync with you."
- Orchestration: Prometheus (plan) → Momus (review) → Sisyphus (execute). Evidence → `.sisyphus/evidence/`.
- Known bugs: daemon blocked by unnecessary ANTHROPIC_API_KEY check (bug #1); source attribution wrong (most "claude-code" sessions are actually OpenCode).
- Strategic moat: cognitive architecture, not MCP protocol. Industry heading toward CodeAct + markdown skills, away from tool-call-heavy MCP.
